text:
#1154Bottle
 Very dark brown, hazy, with high beige head. Aroma of cherries, coffee, yeast, wood. Taste is neutral to sourish, bitter finish. Raisins, dates, roasted malts, coffee, yeast. Medium body and medium to high carbonation. Great dunkler bock!

Bottle 0.33l. Cloudy, dark red to brown colored. AROMA- somewhat insipid, toasted malts, bread crusts, touch of berries. FLAVOR- very smooth, slightly sweet and bitter, toasted malts, bread crusts, lots of nuts. Medium bodied. Great bock.

(draught) murky deep ruby-brown colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of black tea and earth, quite twiggy, with a hint of sugar icing, yeast and autumn foliage. flavour is mostly roasted malts and fallen leaves, again rather earthy, with big notes of roasted chestnuts and a semi-dry finish. full-bodied with soft carbonation.
Tap @Kláterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours almost black with a thinning off white head. Nose is vegetables, grass and hay. Taste is lemon and slight general citrus.

0,5l on tap at Kláterní Pivovar Strahov in Praha. Schwarzes Bier mit toller beiger Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Röstmalze, leicht fruchtig. Im Geschmack intensiv nach Röstmalzen, wunderbar rund und süffig. Vorsicht der Bock zeigt schnell die Hörner!

Keg at the Brewpub in Day 1 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. Thought this was a schwartzbeir. Dimpled mug. Dark black coloured pour with a lasting thin loose head. Aroma is sweet dark chocolate, malty sweet, dme, campfire, earthy notes. Some twigs on the nose as well. Flavour is compposed of sweet, earthy choc, nuts, brown bread, some tangy dried fruits. Palate is quite sweet, lowish carbonation, fullish body. Lingering charrd toasted bread and earthy roast.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Fresh hops, fruity.
Appearance : Opaque black color. Huge, light brown head.
Taste : Medium sweet, light fruity, light roasted, light malty sour.
Palate : Medium body. Dry finish.
Overall : Very nice. Fresh, drinkable.

Tap at the new beergeek bar. opening night!!! me and davey had one each. pours brown with a creamy tan head. aroma of prunes, dried fruit, coffee and hops. tastes dry and malty, with berries and a bitter finish. a good balance of resin hops against dark tangy fruits and coffee. not bad

Beergeek, Prague on 2nd Oct 2014. Two versions of this beer were on offer in KeyKegs. A lager and an ale option. I had both. The ale being very slightly sweeter but otherwise identical in my opinion.

 Dark mahogany brown in colour beer with good beige heads. Coffee aromas meet the nose with some yeast esters and dark red fruitiness. The Taste was again coffee first and foremost with a caramel sweetness tempered by those dark fruits from the aroma. Good start to the day and the long session I had in Beergeek (not the new bar, that only opened the following day).
Slovní hodnocení přidám v nejblií moné době, jakmile jej naťukám do počítače. Vá alkoholík.

Bottle from brewery, brought by a friend,  Dark brown colored beer with medium light beige head. Strong coffee aroma together with yeast, roasted malt, red fruits.Taste, coffee, caramel, dark berries, black berries. Nice coffee bitterness in fruity finish. Tasty.
Ve had this on our last tasting, but unfortunately beer was infected. But this bottle was in best shape.
Bottle. Aroma mostly malty. Light fruity butterness. Taste is lightly buttery. Hoppiness is present, but diacetyl ruins it. Pity.

Bottle, gift from a friend, thanks Martin. Pours black color, creamy beige head. Aroma of black cherries, caramel, roasted malt, coffe. Extremly nice aroma. Taste is medium bitter, low sweetness, coffee, caramel, roasted malt. Nice long mediumbitter finish. Very nice beer.

330 ml shared bottle, as Sv. Norbert Antidepressant Autumn Dark Beer, a gift from a colleague who brought it from Prague, thanks! ABV is 6.3%. Extract content 16%, IBU 45. Nearly black (dark ruby) colour, large beige head. Malty aroma, also notes of over-ripe berries, hints of dark rye bread, chocolate and caramel. Pleasant flavour, malty and mildly roasty, medium sweet, notes of rye bread, chocolate and mild coffee.

0,33 l bottle kindly shared by Sigmund. Label reads "16% Sv. Norbert Antidepressant Autumn Dark Beer". 45 IBU, Abv is 6,3%. Pours a clear deep ruby colored body verging on black covered by a large creamy brown head. Dried fruits, wood, vanilla, malts and hints of spicy chutney on the nose. Full bodied and velvet smooth. Dry roasted sweet malty light ashy mouth.

on tap at the brewery with mowbeer. dark shade of brown with a perfect cream head; aroma has a good balance of prune and date with some grassy hop character; quite a good depth of lactic and dark malt flavours hinting at milk stout, with brandy butter and roasted licorice coming through but with plenty of slightly metallic bitterness keeping things in check. very warm and complex for a dunkelbock. somehow this brewery never fails. i noticed recently while having a look at my stats that this is in my top-rated couple of breweries. makes plenty of sense as they seem able to pull off any style they try

Keg at the Brewpub. Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma was a surprise. Fresh hops with roasted malt in the background. Flavour had delicious pine resin hops and loads of roast character. This was a real treat. I would have guessed it would have been in here as a brown ale.

draught at Klasterni pivnice. Deep brown, almost black colour, creamy beige head. Full-bodied, lovely malt flavours with caramel, roasted malts, chocolate, hints of coffee. Well balanced by delicious fresh hops, resiny, grassy, slightly floral. Well balanced and with a smooth palate. As expected, another convincing beer from this very reliable brewery!

On tap at the brewery restaurant. Pours dark brown color with nice white head. Aroma is fresh green hops with hint of roastiness and malt. Flavor is hops, malt and roastiness in amazing balance and perhaps a hint of licorice. Mildly dry and bitter aftertaste. Very well crafted.

Tap @ Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours black with a creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, nuts, hints of chocolate. Flavor of malts, coffee, nuts, caramel, light chocolate. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry finish. 070812

Bottle, thanks Larsa!
Pours dark brown with a grayish head.
Nice smooth brew with a taste of light chocolate.
Bottle. Sweet... coffee bean dryness... chocolate... milk. Smooth. Well balanced.
Draft at the brew pub. Dark hazy body and a small off-white head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, caramel and coffee. Well balanced taste medium sweetness and light bitterness. Bitter finish.

On tap at the brewery.Pours pitch black with a small tanned head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, roasted coffee. Taste is malty, dark light burnt caramel, roasted barley which mix well with the hops towards the end, which is lingering bitter. Nice brew.
On tap at brewery/restaurant in Prague. Pretty good bock, almost black color, medium sweet caramelish taste and palate. nice white head.

At the brew pub.
Chewy grain, full body. A little sweet and sour. A very decent bock, but it could ahve been even more powerful.

Draught at Strahov. Actually said Autumn Dark on the blackboard heh.  Poured a brown/black body with a tan small-medium head that went away relatively slowly. The nose is basically malt and coffee, nothing too complex but still very nice. A sweet yoghurty and caramelly taste, a bit dry, with notes of coffee. Some very light lemony hop near te end. A bit warming. A nice enough dunkel.
Bottled.  Dark chestnut brown, majestic gead. Fruity nose with a touch of licorice. Soft and desne mouthfeel. there’s licorice and toasty bread togather with perfumy hops. Long salty bitterness.

Bottle (bought at the brewpub, reviewed in my hotel).

Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (molasses, cocoa/chocolate), lightly to moderately hoppy (grapefruit).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Another sourish one from this brewery, and again the aroma just isnt very interesting.  Ok.

On tap at Strahov: Pitch black, mid-sized brownish head, sticking to the glass, deep roast-malty and fruity (dark, dried berries) and distinctive aromatic hoppy nose, quite dry, full bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied, distinctive fruity traces (or liquorice) in the dryish roastmalty-bitter finish. Superbly balanced Bock, not too sweet with  very well hidden alcohol. Gorgeous stuff from a very good pivovar...........
